repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Tiruppukaḻ is a collection of hymns in honour of Murukaṉ by Aruṇakirinātar (15th century).
The bundle is complete. It contains 5 Pāyiram stanzas and 164 Tiruppukāls.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, preface folio (Ciṟappupāyiram), colophon.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Double folio. Verso blank.
1 folio = Tiruppukaḻ: Preface (Ciṟappuppāyiram in print editions). No foliation.
70 folios = Tiruppukaḻ: Mūlam. Tamil foliation 1-70. 5 to 6 lines per page.
1 folio = Colophon. No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Double leaf.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 49.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.

hari Om
naṉṟāka
kaṇapati cakāyam
Ellāru ñāṉat tiṉaiñarē keḷīrkēḷ ‡ kalletu māṇikkak kallāmō pollāk ‡ karuppukaḻaik kēṭkumō
kāṉamayil vīraṉ ‡ tiruppukaḻaik keḷīr tiṉam {pcs} tiruppukaḻ paṭikkumavar
{pcs} vētam
vēṇ ṭāñcakala vittaivēṇ ṭāṅkīta ‡ nātamvēṇ ṭāmñāṉam vēṇṭā māti ‡ kuruppukaḻai mēvukiṉ(ṟa) koṟṟavaṉṟā
ḷ pōṟṟun ‡ tiruppukaḻaik kēḷir tiṉam {pcs} civamayam {pcs} murukayyaṉ tuṇai {pcs} mātāpitākuruteyvan tuṇai {pcs}

tevicakāyam vēlumayilun tuṇai civamayam.
kaittala niṟaiyaval muppaḻa moṭupori kappiya karimuka ṉaṭipēṇik ‡ kattiṭu [i.e. kaṟṟiṭu] maṭiyavar puttiyi (l)u[ṟai]pavar kaṟpa
ka meṉaviṉai kaṭitēku ‡ mattamu matiyamum vaittiṭu maraṉmakaṉ maṟporu tiraḷpuya matayāṉai ‡ maṟṟaḷi [i.e. mattaḷa] vayiṟa
ai yuṟṟami [i.e. yuttami] putalvaṉai maṭṭuṟu malarkoṭu paṇivēṉē ‡ muṟpaṭu kiritaṉil muttami ḻaṭaiviṉai muṟpaṭa veḻutiya mu
talvōṉē ‡ muppura mericeyta vacciva ṉuṟaiva t(o)ccatu poṭiceyta vatitīrā ‡ vacc(ā)vaṇai varu cuppira maṇiyo
ṭu vattuy(ara/ā)tutaṉai yatuvāki ‡ Acciṟu murukaṉai akkuṟa makaḷuṭaṉ Akkaṇa maṇamaruḷiya perumāḷē | 1 |
163 {pcs} pūcal vantiṭu tōṭār kātoṭu mōti ṭuṅkayal māṉār māṉamali pōka maṅkaiyar kōṭā kōṭiyu matiṉālkaṟ ‡ pūra kuṅkuma
t(ū)ḷā yōtapa ṭīra ceṇpaka [i.e. caṇpaka] mālā lāḷita pūta raṅkaḷil mītē mūḻkiya Anurākam ‡ vācai yeṉkuṟa [i.e. yeṅkiṟa] pārā vāramum mēṟu kiṉṟila ṉāṉā pētamum Anēka
tantirakiṟiyāpē [i.e. tantirakiriyāvē] tamum Ākaman talaivāyār ‡ āḻi yumkarai kāṇē ṉ(a) vācakam piṟamaṉutānam pirai pāta paṅkaya mītē ṉākila ṉāyi ṉuṅkuru nātā [nī corrected to nā] nīyaruḷ purivāyē ‡
vāca vaṉpati pāḻā kāveṉ nīca taṅkulam vāḻā tēpaṭi māḷa vaṉkirikūṟāy nīṟeḻa neṭinēmi ‡ māta vaṉtiru vētā vōṭalai pōtu miṉkaṭal kōkō kōve
ṉa vāy viṭum paṭi kū(ra)vē lēviyyi ḷaiyōṉē ‡ vīcu teṉṟalum veḷpū vāḷiyu mīṟu kiṉṟamai yāmo mokavi ṭāyke ṭumpaṭi cārāvākiya teṉa
vēnal ‡ mītu ceṉṟuṟa vāṭā vēṭuvar p(o)ta koṅkaiyil mītē māluṟa vēṭai koṇṭapī [i.e. koṇṭapi] rāṉē vāṉavar perumāḷē {pcs} 164 {pcs}
